hints.content:
Two bars line up with the $\blueD{32}$ on the graph.


[[☃ image 1]]

$\blueD{32}$ students play each of those instruments.

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Instrument and the vertical axis labeled Number of Students. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Flute, Trombone, Saxophone, Trumpet, and Drums. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, and 48. The bar line for each instrument shows the following: Flute bar line extends to 40, Trombone bar line extends to 16, Saxophone bar line extends to 32, Trumpet bar line extends to 24, and Drums bar line extends to 32. A blue line is drawn to the right from 32, which reaches to the end of the Saxophone bar line and to the end of the Drums bar line. Saxophone and Drums bars are highlighted. !

hints.content: The same number of students played the saxophone and drums.

question.content:
Bella counted the number of students who play various instruments in her school's marching band and graphed the results.


[[☃ image 1]]

**Which instruments did the same number of students play?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Instrument and the vertical axis labeled Number of Students. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: Flute, Trombone, Saxophone, Trumpet, and Drums. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: 0, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, and 48. The bar line for each instrument shows the following: Flute bar line extends to 40, Trombone bar line extends to 16, Saxophone bar line extends to 32, Trumpet bar line extends to 24, and Drums bar line extends to 32. !
